name: Texas Brisket
directions: Trim excess fat, leaving about 1/4 inch on the fat cap. Mix salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Coat brisket evenly. Preheat smoker to 225°F using post oak wood. Place brisket fat side up and smoke for 6–7 hours. Wrap in butcher paper and continue smoking until internal temperature reaches 203°F. Rest in a cooler for 1–2 hours before slicing against the grain.

name: Pulled Pork Sandwich
directions: Rub pork shoulder with dry rub. Preheat smoker to 225°F with hickory or applewood. Smoke until internal temperature reaches 165°F (about 6 hours), then wrap in foil and continue to 203°F. Rest for 1 hour. Shred meat, mix with sauce, and serve on toasted buns topped with coleslaw.

name: Smoked Mac & Cheese
directions: Cook macaroni until al dente. In a saucepan, melt butter, add milk and cream, then stir in cheese until smooth. Mix with macaroni and place in foil pan. Top with breadcrumbs. Smoke uncovered at 225°F for 2 hours using mild wood like pecan.

name: Smoked Sausage Platter
directions: Place sausages on smoker at 225°F. Smoke until internal temperature reaches 165°F, about 3 hours. Serve sliced with mustard, pickles, and white bread.

name: BBQ Chicken Quarters
directions: Pat chicken dry and apply rub under and over the skin. Smoke at 250°F until internal temperature is 175°F (around 3 hours). Brush with BBQ sauce and continue smoking uncovered for 30 more minutes to set the glaze.

name: Burnt Ends
directions: Smoke brisket point as you would a full brisket (see Texas Brisket). Once it hits 203°F, cube it and toss in a mix of BBQ sauce and brown sugar. Return cubes to smoker in a foil pan and cook for 1 more hour until caramelized and sticky.

name: Pork Belly Bites
directions: Cube pork belly and coat with rub. Smoke at 250°F for 2 hours. Transfer to a pan with honey and sugar, cover with foil, and return for 1 hour. Uncover and cook 30 minutes more until caramelized.

name: Smoked Jalapeño Poppers
directions: Halve and core jalapeños. Mix cream cheese and cheddar, fill each half, and wrap with bacon. Smoke at 250°F for 2 hours or until bacon is crisp and cheese is bubbly.

name: BBQ Chicken Sandwich
directions: Season thighs and smoke at 250°F until internal temperature reaches 175°F. Rest, then shred and toss with sauce. Serve on buns with pickles.

name: Cornbread
directions: Mix dry and wet ingredients separately, then combine. Pour into greased cast iron skillet and bake on smoker at 350°F for 1 hour or until golden brown and firm in the center.

name: Smoked Baked Beans
directions: In a foil pan, combine beans, sugar, sauce, and onion. Lay bacon strips on top. Smoke at 275°F uncovered for 3 hours until thickened and bacon is cooked.

name: Smoked Corn on the Cob
directions: Peel back husks without removing them. Butter and season corn, then wrap husks back around. Smoke at 250°F for 1.5 hours until tender.

name: Beef Rib Platter
directions: Season ribs with salt and pepper. Smoke at 275°F for 7–8 hours until internal temp reaches 203°F and they probe like butter. Rest before slicing.

name: Smoked Bologna Sandwich
directions: Score bologna and coat with rub. Smoke at 250°F for 2 hours. Slice thick and serve on bread with mustard.

name: Smoked Potato Salad
directions: Parboil and cube potatoes. Smoke them in a foil pan for 1 hour at 250°F. Cool, then mix with remaining ingredients. Chill before serving.

name: Smoked Chicken Wings
directions: Rub wings and smoke at 250°F for 2 hours. Toss in hot sauce and butter mixture. Return to smoker or broil briefly to crisp.

name: Triple-Smoked Cheeseburger
directions: Form patties and smoke at 225°F until internal temp hits 135°F. Top with cheese and bacon. Toast buns on smoker. Assemble with BBQ aioli.

name: Brisket Grilled Cheese
directions: Butter the outside of bread. Layer cheese and brisket inside. Cook on griddle or smoker at 350°F until golden and melty.

name: Smoked Deviled Eggs
directions: Peel and halve eggs. Smoke at 225°F for 1 hour. Mix yolks with mayo, mustard, and paprika. Pipe filling into whites.

name: BBQ Meat Sampler
directions: Prepare each meat per its recipe. Slice and plate with pickles, onions, and bread for a hearty platter.

name: Smoked Peach Cobbler
directions: Place peaches, sugar, and cinnamon in a cast iron skillet. Top with cake mix and sliced butter. Smoke at 350°F for 1.5 hours until golden and bubbling.
